intro: Heracleum incanum var. lazicum, commonly known as the Caucasian cow parsley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its hollow, aromatic stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like inflorescences, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in meadows and along forest edges. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
